intro: Hemiandra glabra, commonly known as the smooth hemiandra, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its aromatic, glandular leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are woody capsules that release seeds when mature. Hemiandra glabra is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
